title: Rotorua Presbyterian church 'destroyed' by fire
text:
Rotorua Presbyterian church 'destroyed' by fire Last updated 19:12, February 8 2017 BENN BATHGATE/FAIRFAX NZ. 
Firefighters battle to put out blaze. 
A church has been gutted by a fire that caused smoke and flames which could be seen from the other end of town, witnesses say. 
Several fire crews are tackling the fire at the St John Presbyterian Church on the corner of Ranolf and Victoria Streets in Rotorua. 
Rotorua resident Dominique Gupwell said church roof is gone. BENN BATHGATE 
Fire crew doing their best to extinguish the fire. 
"It's all gone, you can't hear the windows being smashed anymore... it's destroyed," she said. 
At least 50 people had gathered around the cordons to watch the fire. 
"There are so many people here," said Gupwell. BENN BATHGATE/FAIRFAX NZ. 
Firefighters work to extinguish a blaze at a Rotorua church. 
"Everyone knows this church, it's been there for ages. If you're from Rotorua you'll know the church." 
The church was "well involved" by fire at 6pm on Wednesday. Witnesses said smoke and flames can be seen from the other end of town. 
Cordons are in place in the city centre including Ranolf and Ruihi Streets. 
One woman was seen wailing on the corner of Victoria and Herewini Sts where the cordon is up. 
"There is a strong smell of gas, it smells really bad," Gupwell said. 
"There are still at least five fire engines [at the scene]." 
Gupwell said firefighters knocked down a corrugated iron fence to get better access to the church. 
"They look like they're getting reading to go inside the church, they're putting their suits and that on." - Stuff
